author: cnbc.com
title: Agilent reports 1Q loss
text:
SANTA CLARA, Calif. (AP) _ Agilent Technologies Inc. (A) on Wednesday reported a fiscal first-quarter loss of $320 million, after reporting a profit in the same period a year earlier.
The Santa Clara, California-based company said it had a loss of 99 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for pretax expenses and amortization costs, were 66 cents per share.
The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 10 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 58 cents per share.
The scientific instrument maker posted revenue of $1.21 billion in the period, also beating Street forecasts. Seven analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $1.16 billion.
Agilent shares have climbed 4 percent since the beginning of the year, while the Standard & Poor's 500 index has increased 1 percent. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $69.71, an increase of 38 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on A at https://www.zacks.com/ap/A
